questions.option_c: Hamlet said, "I will go home the next day"
questions.option_d: Hamlet said, "I will go home tomrrow".
questions.explanation: Step 1: Identify the tense change In indirect speech, “would” is the past form of “will” . “The following day” in indirect speech corresponds to “tomorrow” in direct speech. Step 2: Convert back to direct speech Replace would → shall/will (depending on style, “shall” is more formal for first person). Replace the following day → tomorrow So the direct speech becomes: Hamlet said, "I shall go home tomorrow." ✅ Step 3: Check the options ক: Hamlet said, "I shall go home tomorrow" ✅ Correct খ: Hamlet said, "I shall go home the next day" ❌ (still indirect style) গ: Hamlet said, "I will go home the next day" ❌ (still indirect style) ঘ: Hamlet said, "I will go home tomrrow" ❌ (typo “tomrrow” and minor style issue)

questions.explanation: CDE এবং BAE are similar কারূণ all three angles are equal.  সুতরাং  C D A B = D E A E ⇒ 9 3 = D E A E ⇒ 9 A E = 3 D E ⇒ 3 A E = D E  যেহেতু  A D = A E + D E = 4 ∴ A E = 1 , D E = 3  Area  A E C =  Area  A C D −  Area  C D E = 1 2 × 9 × 4 − 1 2 × 9 × 3 = 18 − 13.5 = 4.5 \begin{array}{l} \text { সুতরাং } \frac{\mathrm{CD}}{\mathrm{AB}}=\frac{\mathrm{DE}}{\mathrm{AE}} \\ \begin{aligned} \Rightarrow \frac{9}{3}=\frac{\mathrm{DE}}{\mathrm{AE}} & \Rightarrow 9 \mathrm{AE}=3 \mathrm{DE} \Rightarrow 3 \mathrm{AE}=\mathrm{DE} \end{aligned} \\ \begin{array}{l} \text { যেহেতু } \mathrm{AD}=\mathrm{AE}+\mathrm{DE}=4 \\ \therefore \mathrm{AE}=1, \mathrm{DE}=3 \end{array} \\ \begin{aligned} \text { Area } \mathrm{AEC} & =\text { Area } \mathrm{ACD}-\text { Area } \mathrm{CDE} \\ & =\frac{1}{2} \times 9 \times 4-\frac{1}{2} \times 9 \times 3=18-13.5=4.5 \end{aligned} \end{array}   সুতরাং   AB CD ​ = AE DE ​ ⇒ 3 9 ​ = AE DE ​ ​ ⇒ 9 AE = 3 DE ⇒ 3 AE = DE ​   যেহেতু   AD = AE + DE = 4 ∴ AE = 1 , DE = 3 ​  Area  AEC ​ =  Area  ACD −  Area  CDE = 2 1 ​ × 9 × 4 − 2 1 ​ × 9 × 3 = 18 − 13.5 = 4.5 ​ ​
